name: qwerty
text: A comment left by qwerty was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ShemmJacc, madnes, Overmedicated, SixtySwine, kylemcjuicy, odei, mortshire, mike24, DigDugz, cbtbone, lastlarf, Madoushi)

name: qwerty
text: Just had to beat me to it.

name: zefiel
text: Can I mark you as spam then? X3 Rockin' Icon, dude.

name: someone3
text: that is one of the default icons, which i soon after saved to my computer for later use after i got it as mine when i signed up. also, don't make as spam, it was a mistake not spam.

name: lateadopter
text: Absolutely right.  It looks like the two comments were posted pretty much simultaneously.  There's no reason to give chubbies to one and lames to the other, let alone spam.

name: zefiel
text: I was jokin', no one's marked it as spam. There was a good difference of almost 10 minutes, tho. not really simultaneously. What I find more Interesting is that i think she made an account, and got the idea to post the alt text, or it was going to be her very fist alt text posted (as mine) since she doesn't seem to have a lot of prior posts.

name: lateadopter
text:
You're a good guy, and you were obviously joking, but somebody lamed that thing, just lamed it all to hell. The other day the system restricted me because I got 8 lames for posting something stupid. Qwerty doesn't deserve that, especially if it's one of her first posts.

"No one should be a cock to a stranger, ever."

name: zefiel
text: The system seriously restricts people? That's a novel and harsh feature, but of course it can be hella abused. Dang. We still need to work out the kinks in the Achemmunity.

name: lateadopter
text:
Yeah, the system told me to "try being nice for a change." I thought my problem was being found stupid and uncool in public. The entire forum held the knife that cut off my access.

I think it's the EigenVector thing they mentioned when they introduced the Ignore feature; it's in a comment from AssetBar_admin under the strip on May 10, 2007. They are aware of the downsides, and they're working on more flexible and powerful solutions.

name: lateadopter
text: Wait, I clearly don't know what I'm talking about.  Wehavemagnums wrote that he ran out of chubbies for this page, lower down on this list.  I can't see why they'd limit chubbies for either the uncool or the cool.  Must a be a quota thing.

name: zefiel
text: Yeah, the system is interesting/puzzling.. I think it's based either on days, or on some weird karmic balance, the more chubbies you give, the more lames, or something.

name: atticusonline
text: You folk are insightful

text: Poor Beef. To him, marriage is like a violent crime and any ring he gives Molly is an explosive or firearm. These are the necessary props that make sentences transform forever the lives of their speaker.

text: I don't know how we got from the lawn war arc to here, but suddenly we're in the middle of something big and I'm getting tingly feelings.

text: Man I can't tell if it'll happen or not. All I know is that this is a beautiful strip and I love it.

name: johnstephens
text: Predication: Pat comes in sniping for someone who said "fuck you" to him, and hits Molly by mistake. Beef follows Molly to Heaven and asks her there.

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: Ten years later, in heaven:  MOLLY!  ARE YOU CRAPPIN'?  YOU FEED THE DOG YET?

name: someone3
text: a cat owning a dog? heaven sure is a weird place. im going to spark up a J with God, peace.

name: catachresis
text:
The longer and more bizarre strips in the lawn war arc were good, but very much left me cold. This is the perfect tonic, short and beautiful.
Why can't I stay mad at you, Achewood

name: evolume
text: On a related note, another potentially crippling sentence is "Your daughter and I are getting married."  When I said this to the guy, he actually cried in front of me.  Then nobody said anything at all for a full 3 or 4 minutes.

name: wehavemagnums
text: Ouch.

name: someone3
text: was he happy or sad?

name: aperson
text: He was tied to a chair.

name: ttagxamm
text: Ha!  You just made me laugh out loud, with this, aperson, but I have no more internet gold stars to give out, so I'll just say thanks!

name: majormajor
text: epic comic

name: lateadopter
text:
Lie Bot, what is the saddest thing?

The saddest thing is a cat who came from Circumstances. He was depressed his whole life, and then he was shot and killed by his friends several times.

N--

Wait, there's more. The cat went to heaven where he met his true love.

... But that's good!

No, then heaven burned down, and she burnt up, and the depressed cat commissioned No-No to do the murder act on him.

No--

Wait, wait, I'm not done yet. They came back to Earth, and now she puts up with his snoring and the way he ruins the evening every time they go out to a nice restaurant. She remembers the things he says, and buys him Christmas presents three years in advance. His friends think she's the best thing that ever happened to him and he should marry her.

... How is that sad? They're happy!

He is afraid to ask because she might say yes.

NOOOOO!!!

name: catachresis
text: You, sir, have done well

name: tombsgrave
text: That is a marvelous summary of the Roast Beef Experience.  Bravo!

name: mastronaut
text: Oh man, I used up all of my chubbies. You get five.

name: centipede_damascus
text: When Beef gets home, Molly is taking a meatloaf out of the oven, all wearing a nice apron and humming a tune. What man could stand against that?

name: le_chien_manquee
text: A comment left by le_chien_manquee was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, gouldgonewild, salvagebar, mortshire, bug, TombsGrave)

name: lateadopter
text:
Clearly meatloaf is a central problem in most people's lives. However, Roast Beef is not fond of any kind of food, and he is capable of aggression only when he's defending a friend .

You are confusing him with Nice Pete, or maybe Nice Pete's dad . Or possibly (and much worse) Philippe's evil stage mom .

name: johnnylandmine
text: Man, for the past few days I've been trying to recall the strip where the line "you dis my dog you fluff my hog" was uttered. And here you have handed it right to me.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Am I like the only dude who enjoys a nicely cooked meatloaf or what?

name: lateadopter
text: I'm glad to hear you are able to admit this in public without shame or fear of stigma.  It says so much about the progress that society has made.  Does your family support your choice?

name: jackparsons
text:
I believe you are confusing meatloaf with fruitcake. They do seem to have similar anatomy and origins.

I'm a veg, and I'd have to say my fond memories of mom's really good ML will have to do. A faux meat ML would be vile. The ToFuckYou is decent with spices.

name: odei
text:
DENISE! YOU COOKIN' MEATLOAF?

YOU FEED THE DOG YET?

text: good gracious, that is a disgusting euphemism.

name: featurelessvoid
text: A nice bit of continuity: Roast Beef seems to have a habit of wearing the hoodie when troubled.

name: johnnylandmine
text: I just dig the hell out of the implication that at least some significant part of Beef's brain is structured like a grainy educational film. What country do I need to sneak into to get the illegal operation that will do this for me?

name: rowboat
text: Drugs.

I think this is the most touching moment yet. Tears spring into my eyes whenever I read it.

What the christ and this is about an anthropomorphic cat marriage sfsfadasdsad.

I've said it, she said yes.

Three months later she said no.

It was about three years ago.

Also I'm fine, thanks.

text: ok, good.  i dont want you to be sad.

name: saru
text: Am I, or am I not alone in thinking that Beef looks absolutely adorable in this strip?

name: dusty
text: The pig in goggles stands in a box, the wall in front of him lowers, it's a friend that he has always had a crush on but never had the chance to approach in that way, she is very beautiful by pig standards. A red light blinks 3 times and a buzzer sounds. The girl pig says "Randy, you're like a brother to me, I know we'll be friends forever!" The pig in goggles curls into a ball and vomits. A man in a lab coat takes a note on his clipboard.
